|   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| - | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A beautiful rainbow of colour and motion trapped within a delicate crystal on a thin silver chain. Listening carefully, one can hear the distant echo of a thousand dreams from all corners of reality, their melody giving a warm sense of safety. |

[![Dreamshard necklace.png](/images/3/3d/Dreamshard_necklace.png)](/File:Dreamshard_necklace.png) ***the dreamshard necklace***

[Amulet of the acrobat](/Amulet_of_the_acrobat "Amulet of the acrobat")

Protects the wearer from lethal damage once

## Contents

- [1 Mechanics](#Mechanics)
- [2 Desirability](#Desirability)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 References](#References)

## Mechanics

If the user would be reduced to 0 HP,[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) the dreamshard necklace's \*Dream effect activates, causing the following effects:[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

- The triggering blow is negated; the wearer is left at 1 HP. [Poison](/Poison "Poison") is removed, but [Sticky Flame](/Sticky_Flame "Sticky Flame") and [Flay](/Flay "Flay") are not.
- The wearer is immune to all damage until their next action.
- [Shadow Creatures](/Shadow_Creatures "Shadow Creatures") is cast, creating several floor-appropriate allies
- A [bank of fog](/Scroll_of_fog "Scroll of fog") is created.

Afterwards, it loses the \*Dream property, effectively becoming a regular amulet of the acrobat.

## Desirability

The **dreamshard necklace**[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) lets you escape from a deadly situation once a game. This lets you take somewhat greater risks than you otherwise would.

- At a human level of play, [mistakes](/YASD "YASD") of some kind are inevitable. It can save you as you were mindlessly [tabbing](/Tab "Tab") enemies.
- For careful players, it can increase risk tolerance. For example: say a god ability has a 95% chance of keeping you alive, but a [scroll of blinking](/Scroll_of_blinking "Scroll of blinking") has a 100% chance. Normally, you should use the scroll of blinking ASAP, since a 5% chance of death is too high in a permadeath game. With the dreamshard necklace, however, you can afford the risk. You can use the god ability, thus saving you from having to use the scroll 95% of the time.
- There are a few cases where you can [instantly die](/Instadeath "Instadeath") in 1 turn, from 100% health, due no fault of your own. For instance, you could be teleported into the lungs of [Zot:5](/Zot:5 "Zot:5"), and take too much damage. This amulet offers some protection against these theoretical cases.

It is best not to *rely* on the dreamshard necklace, since the \*Dream effect can only be used once, and it only saves you for 1 turn. Thus, you should make sure you have a way to escape at 1 HP. Aside from those stipulations, if this amulet is used carefully, it can be a powerful tool.

Despite already having multiple lives, [Felids](/Felid "Felid") still somewhat benefit from this amulet, since their extra lives are limited.

## History

- Prior to [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"):

  - The dreamshard necklace didn't have [Acrobat](/Acrobat "Acrobat"), and drained the wearer on unequip. Also, when activated, the necklace was destroyed (this didn't trigger the \*Drain).
  - The \*Dream effect would restore 50% - 100% of your max HP, instead of leaving you at 1 HP.
  - The \*Dream effect had a 50% chance to activate if you lost half of your current HP in a single turn.

- The dreamshard necklace was added in [0.28](/0.28 "0.28").

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [ouch.cc:1063](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.31-b1/crawl-ref/source/ouch.cc#L1063) (0.31-b1)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [spl-goditem.cc:1326](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.31-b1/crawl-ref/source/spl-goditem.cc#L1326) (0.31-b1)

  • A bank of fog is created.

Afterwards, it loses the *Dream property, effectively becoming a regular amulet of the acrobat.

Desirability

The dreamshard necklace[3] lets you escape from a deadly situation once a game. This lets you take somewhat greater risks than you otherwise would.

  • At a human level of play, mistakes of some kind are inevitable. It can save you as you were mindlessly tabbing enemies.
  • For careful players, it can increase risk tolerance. For example: say a god ability has a 95% chance of keeping you alive, but a scroll of blinking has a 100% chance. Normally, you should use the scroll of blinking ASAP, since a 5% chance of death is too high in a permadeath game. With the dreamshard necklace, however, you can afford the risk. You can use the god ability, thus saving you from having to use the scroll 95% of the time.
  • There are a few cases where you can instantly die in 1 turn, from 100% health, due no fault of your own. For instance, you could be teleported into the lungs of Zot:5, and take too much damage. This amulet offers some protection against these theoretical cases.

It is best not to rely on the dreamshard necklace, since the *Dream effect can only be used once, and it only saves you for 1 turn. Thus, you should make sure you have a way to escape at 1 HP. Aside from those stipulations, if this amulet is used carefully, it can be a powerful tool.

Despite already having multiple lives, Felids still somewhat benefit from this amulet, since their extra lives are limited.

  • Prior to 0.31:
    • The dreamshard necklace didn't have Acrobat, and drained the wearer on unequip. Also, when activated, the necklace was destroyed (this didn't trigger the *Drain).
